As New Business Manager
Rue Helsel was elected business manager of Radio Station
WJHU in a general staff meeting held recently, according to
Station Manager Frank Zampiello.
Helsel replaces Sal Cantolino
who has resigned to work on a
master's degree. At an SAC

"When I was installed as Business Manager of station WJHU
last year I sought to maintain
the system of bookkeeping and
financial management that my
predecessors had used before me
and the only one with which I
was
familiar. This system,
though it remained successful

this. Over the course of last
summer, without my having any
knowledge of it whatsoever, the
Station Manager of this organization delegated to certain freshmen on the staff of all the advertising responsibilities of the
station and with it a "carte
blanche" in the realm of finances.
As a consequence when I returned at the end of September
I was greeted by an entirely new
WJHU whose financial scope
and problems had grown enormously and as a result sbme of
the blils handed to me at that
time were of the same ridiculous
proportions."
SAC member Jordan Agronick

"The whole business staff could
have shown more interest, but I
feel that now all the trouble
is straightened out."

HOMEWOOD, BALTIMORE, JAN. 11, 1957

Dr. Lattimore To Present
Percy Turnbull Lectures
Dr. Richard Lattimore, Paul
Shorey Professor of Greek at
Bryn Mawr College, has been selected to present the Percy Turnbull Memorial Lectures at The
Johns Hopkins University January 14 through 25.
Professor Lattimore, whose
translations of Pindar, Homer
and Aeschylus are regarded as
being superior in accuracy and
literary rendering to all previous
translations, will present six lectures under the title: "Studies In
The Poetry of Greek Tragedy."
Professor Lattimore's lecture
series will be given in Mergenthaler Hall, Room 111, on the

Homewood campus. Each lecture
will begin at 4 p.m. and will be
open to the public without
charge.
